column5: Al, I have stayed at Tomahawk Resort (www.tomahawkresort.com)on lake of the woods for a couple of years now. The fishing up on that part of the lake is awesome for smallies, northern's and walleyes. They have very nice housekeeping accomodations and boats. They also have a campground. Going back for my 5th year this June!Good luck!

We are planning on making a trip to Canada, fishing for Walleye, Norther, and Lake troute. Hope to keep the driving to around 8 to 10 hours north of the twin cities.We would like to stay away from the huge lakes and are open for house keeping plans or tent camping. Can anyone give us some referances on some nice but economy type places. Thanks Al
AL CHECK OUT SEPARATION LAKE LODGE THAY HAVE A CAMPGROUND YOU CAN DRIVE TO.THE LODGE IS A BOAT-IN.CLOSE TO KENORA (ENGLISH RIVER)LOOK AT THE POSTS ABOUT LOUNT LAKE. GOOD LUCK AND FISH IT.

Check www.whitefishbaycamp.com Do not let the fact that this is Lake of the Woods stop you because Whitefish Bay has lots of protected water but everything you want and on 75 miles from Int. Falls. Check them out.
Try this<a href=http://www.ontariofishing.net/linkspages/Fishing_Lodges/>Stay off the pipe...and don't forget to wipe.Red

There are lots of places and lots of opinions out here. I own a lodge 10 hours N of Minneapolis at the end of the road 42 miles NE of Ear Falls, South Bay Lodge <http://www.southbaylodge.com> . We don't have camp grounds but we do offer housekeeping cabins and since we are the only lodge fishing on Confederation Lake our fishing is very good for Northern, Lake Trout and we have great Walleye fishing in our small portage lakes (like a fly-in for a day). good luck,
Greetings I agree ,separation lake resort and campground is the place to go.4th trip to it coming in july,outstanding fishing!!!!!!!! Rich
www.eaglenest.mb.caNo need to deal with those windy Ontario roads, or any gravel. Only about 4.5 hours from Grand Forks
Eagle Nest is a great place to go...fishing is great and the Hosts are the best...
Al-I have a 3 bedroom cottage that I rent out by the week on Rainy Lake-its on an island but very close to mainland-if you are interested [email protected] thanks Walli
